medical_history.chief_complaint: Patient admitted for coronary angiography due to findings of abnormal ST tract.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was asymptomatic at the time of admission in June 2003. There were no symptoms of inflammatory or connective tissue disease. In May 2004, a repeat angiogram showed no coronary stenosis but a significant enlargement of the right coronary artery aneurysm from the previous year's findings, prompting surgical intervention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Dyslipidemia, hypertension, history of smoking (40 cigarettes per day), and negative history for inflammatory or connective tissue disease.
medical_history.family_history: Positive family history of ischemic heart disease.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is a smoker, consuming 40 cigarettes per day.
